required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Maternal Psychological Implications of Covid-19 Pandemic and Possible Effect on Anaesthetic Management.
clinical_study.official_title: Maternal Psychological Implications of Covid-19 Pandemic and Possible Effect on Anaesthetic Management.

lead_sponsor.agency: General and Maternity Hospital of Athens Elena Venizelou

clinical_study.source: General and Maternity Hospital of Athens Elena Venizelou

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to assess the maternal psychological implication of the novel coronavirus COvid-19 pandemic. At the same time it will be evaluated whether there is an impact of these implications on the anaesthetic practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Association between Covid-19 pandemic and maternal psychological distress
primary_outcome.description: Association between Covid-19 pandemic and maternal psychological distress assessed by 2 scales and one questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between Covid-19 pandemic, maternal psychological distress and anaesthetic practice
secondary_outcome.description: Association between Covid-19 pandemic and anaesthetic practice assessed by a 38 questions questionnaire

arm_group.description: Pregnant women administered into a maternity public hospital in labour (vaginal delivery, caesarean section)

intervention.description: It involves a 9-question scale that detects depression
It involves a 7-question scale that detects general anxiety disorder
It involves a 38 question questionnaire that aims to detect any association between the Covid-19 pandemic, the psychological impllications and anaesthetic practice

study_pop.textblock: All women in labour that present into the maternity hospital from June-August 2020, during the Covid-19 pandemic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All pregnant women over the age of 18 that present in labour (vaginal delivery or caesarean section)
Exclusion Criteria:
- psychiatric disorders
- drug abuse
- not eligible to read and write in Greek

overall_official.affiliation: Elena Venizelou General and Maternity Hospital of Athens, Greece

facility.name: "Elena Venizelou" General and Maternity Hospital of Athens

reference.citation: Thapa SB, Mainali A, Schwank SE, Acharya G. Maternal mental health in the time of the COVID-19 pandemic. Acta Obstet Gynecol Scand. 2020 Jul;99(7):817-818. doi: 10.1111/aogs.13894.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: General and Maternity Hospital of Athens Elena Venizelou
